form.longName: PhenX PX220702 - Disease Progression And Regression 2-11 Years
form.preferredDefinition: The Newcastle Paediatric Mitochondrial Disease Scale (NPMDS) and the Newcastle Mitochondrial Disease Adult Scale (NMDAS) can be used to evaluate the progression of mitochondrial disease. There are three versions of the NPMDS, each for a specific age range (0-24 months, 2-11 years, and 12-18 years). The NMDAS is for adult patients over 16 years. The aim of the scales is to allow for standardization of patient assessment and to improve accurate data collection. The scales are composed of multiple domains: Current Function, System Specific Involvement, Current Clinical Assessment, and Quality of Life. Almost all questions provide a score which ranges from 0-3, with the following representations: 0 is normal, 1 is mild, 2 moderate, and 3 severe. Examples of each severity for each question are provided. Depending on the domain, the questions are either self-administrated or based on a provider's clinical assessment. There is a manual for each scale, which details the administration, process, and scoring instructions.

headerInstruction.text: The Newcastle Paediatric Mitochondrial Disease Scale (NPMDS) 211 years

question.questionText: Date of assessment: (disease_progressionregression_2to11_date)
Age at assessment: (disease_progressionregression_2to11_age)
Parental consanguinity: (disease_progressionregression_2to11_parental_consanguinity)
Age at presentation: (disease_progressionregression_2to11_parental_agepresentation)
Age at clinical diagnosis: (disease_progressionregression_2to11_parentalage_agedx)
Genotype if known: (disease_progressionregression_2to11_genotype)
Biochemical phenotype if known: (disease_progressionregression_2to11_biochemical_phenotype)
Basis of clinical diagnosis e.g. MRI, blood / CSF lactate (disease_progressionregression_2to11_basis_diagnosis)
Information regarding pregnancy: reduced fetal movements (disease_progressionregression_2to11_reduced_fetalmovement)
Information regarding pregnancy: cardiomyopathy on antenatal scans (disease_progressionregression_2to11_pregnancy_cardiomyopathy_antenatal)
Information regarding pregnancy: abnormalities on fetal anomaly scan (disease_progressionregression_2to11_abnormalities_fetalscan)
Other (disease_progressionregression_2to11_pregnancy_cardiomyopathy_pregnancyother)
Neonatal information: gestational age in weeks (disease_progressionregression_2to11_neonatal_gestationalage)
Neonatal information: delivery method (NVD vs instrumental vs C/S) (disease_progressionregression_2to11_neonatal_deliverymethod)
Neonatal information: birth weight in kg (disease_progressionregression_2to11_neonatal_birthweight)
Neonatal information: Resuscitation and ventilation (disease_progressionregression_2to11_neonatal_resuscitationventilation)

Section I: Current Function Rate function during the preceding 4 week period only according to patient and / or caregiver interview. Indicate the score that best fits patient's functional status independently of the nature of the signs. (section_i_220702)
Rate function during the preceding 4 week period only according to patient and / or caregiver interview. Vision (disease_progressionregression_2to11_currentfunction_vision)

validValue.meaningText: 1. Mild. Inattention to small objects in visual field or parent concerned about abnormality of visual behavior
validValue.description: 1. Mild. Inattention to small objects in visual field or parent concerned about abnormality of visual behavior

validValue.meaningText: 2. Moderate. Visual impairment not fully corrected with glasses or inattention to large objects in visual field
validValue.description: 2. Moderate. Visual impairment not fully corrected with glasses or inattention to large objects in visual field

validValue.meaningText: 3. Severe. Not recognising faces or registered blind or using additional visual aids
validValue.description: 3. Severe. Not recognising faces or registered blind or using additional visual aids

question.questionText: Rate function during the preceding 4 week period only according to patient and / or caregiver interview. Hearing (disease_progressionregression_2to11_currentfunction_hearing)

validValue.meaningText: 1. Mild. Requires regular repetition / raised voice or not reacting to loud sounds
validValue.description: 1. Mild. Requires regular repetition / raised voice or not reacting to loud sounds

validValue.meaningText: 2. Moderate. Hearing impaired but fully corrected with hearing aid
validValue.description: 2. Moderate. Hearing impaired but fully corrected with hearing aid

validValue.meaningText: 3. Severe. Poor hearing even with aid
validValue.description: 3. Severe. Poor hearing even with aid

question.questionText: Rate function during the preceding 4 week period only according to patient and / or caregiver interview. communication (assessed with appropriate regard for age) (disease_progressionregression_2to11_currentfunction_communication)

validValue.meaningText: 1. Mild. Verbal communication impaired. Supplemented by alternative methods (e.g. signing, pointing)
validValue.description: 1. Mild. Verbal communication impaired. Supplemented by alternative methods (e.g. signing, pointing)

validValue.meaningText: 2. Moderate. Not communicating effectively with strangers (irrespective of methods)
validValue.description: 2. Moderate. Not communicating effectively with strangers (irrespective of methods)

validValue.meaningText: 3. Severe. Not communicating effectively with parents (irrespective of methods)
validValue.description: 3. Severe. Not communicating effectively with parents (irrespective of methods)

question.questionText: Rate function during the preceding 4 week period only according to patient and / or caregiver interview. Feeding (disease_progressionregression_2to11_currentfunction_feeding)

validValue.meaningText: 1. Mild. Choking / vomiting / anorexia resulting in reduced intake or adaptation of age appropriate diet
validValue.description: 1. Mild. Choking / vomiting / anorexia resulting in reduced intake or adaptation of age appropriate diet

validValue.meaningText: 2. Moderate. Supplementary enteral feeding or recurrent aspiration pneumonia
validValue.description: 2. Moderate. Supplementary enteral feeding or recurrent aspiration pneumonia

validValue.meaningText: 3. Severe. Exclusive enteral feeding (gastrostomy / NG tube). Nil by mouth
validValue.description: 3. Severe. Exclusive enteral feeding (gastrostomy / NG tube). Nil by mouth

question.questionText: Rate function during the preceding 4 week period only according to patient and / or caregiver interview. Selfcare (personal hygiene, dressing, utensil use e.g. for feeding) (disease_progressionregression_2to11_currentfunction_selfcare)

validValue.meaningText: 0. Normal. No concerns. Age appropriately reliant on carers / parents
validValue.description: 0. Normal. No concerns. Age appropriately reliant on carers / parents

validValue.meaningText: 1. Mild. Requires help with some age appropriate tasks
validValue.description: 1. Mild. Requires help with some age appropriate tasks

validValue.meaningText: 2. Moderate. Requires help with all age appropriate tasks
validValue.description: 2. Moderate. Requires help with all age appropriate tasks

validValue.meaningText: 3. Severe. Reliant on parents with no contribution to self care
validValue.description: 3. Severe. Reliant on parents with no contribution to self care

question.questionText: Rate function during the preceding 4 week period only according to patient and / or caregiver interview. Mobility (disease_progressionregression_2to11_currentfunction_mobility)

validValue.meaningText: 0. Normal. No concerns. Age appropriate mobility
validValue.description: 0. Normal. No concerns. Age appropriate mobility

validValue.meaningText: 1. Mild. Difficulty walking up stairs or inclines.
validValue.description: 1. Mild. Difficulty walking up stairs or inclines.

validValue.meaningText: 2. Moderate. Requires support (stick / frame / callipers) to walk on the flat
validValue.description: 2. Moderate. Requires support (stick / frame / callipers) to walk on the flat

question.questionText: Rate function during the preceding 4 week period only according to patient and / or caregiver interview. Educational Achievement (disease_progressionregression_2to11_currentfunction_education)

validValue.meaningText: 0. Normal. Academic achievement comparable to peers in mainstream school /nursery
validValue.description: 0. Normal. Academic achievement comparable to peers in mainstream school /nursery

validValue.meaningText: 1. Mild. Struggling to remain in mainstream school / nursery
validValue.description: 1. Mild. Struggling to remain in mainstream school / nursery

validValue.meaningText: 3. Severe. Not attending school / nursery primarily due to illness
validValue.description: 3. Severe. Not attending school / nursery primarily due to illness

question.questionText: Section II: System Specific Involvement Rate system specific involvement during the preceding 6 month period only unless otherwise stated in the question. Scores should be assigned according to patient and / or caregiver interview, clinician's knowledge of the patient and clinical notes. (section_ii_220702)
Rate system specific involvement during the preceding 6 month period only unless otherwise stated in the question. Seizures (disease_progressionregression_2to11_systeminvolvement_seizures)

validValue.meaningText: 1. Mild. Myoclonic or absence seizures only or < 1 generalised tonic-clonic seizure/month
validValue.description: 1. Mild. Myoclonic or absence seizures only or < 1 generalised tonic-clonic seizure/month

validValue.meaningText: 2. Moderate. > 5 generalized tonic-clonic seizures/month or > 20 absence or myoclonic seizures/month
validValue.description: 2. Moderate. > 5 generalized tonic-clonic seizures/month or > 20 absence or myoclonic seizures/month

question.questionText: Rate system specific involvement during the preceding 6 month period only unless otherwise stated in the question. Encephalopathy (disease_progressionregression_2to11_systeminvolvement_encephalopathy)

validValue.meaningText: 1. Mild. Single episode of personality change, excessive sleepiness, confusion or disorientation
validValue.description: 1. Mild. Single episode of personality change, excessive sleepiness, confusion or disorientation

validValue.meaningText: 3. Severe. Life-threatening encephalopathy- requires artificial ventilation
validValue.description: 3. Severe. Life-threatening encephalopathy- requires artificial ventilation

question.questionText: Rate system specific involvement during the preceding 6 month period only unless otherwise stated in the question. Strokelike Episodes (disease_progressionregression_2to11_systeminvolvement_strokelike)

validValue.meaningText: 1. Mild. Transient motor symptoms lasting < 24 hours
validValue.description: 1. Mild. Transient motor symptoms lasting < 24 hours

validValue.meaningText: 3. Severe. Multiple stroke-like episodes (> 24 hours each)
validValue.description: 3. Severe. Multiple stroke-like episodes (> 24 hours each)

question.questionText: Rate system specific involvement during the preceding 6 month period only unless otherwise stated in the question. Gastrointestinal (disease_progressionregression_2to11_systeminvolvement_gastrointestinal)

validValue.meaningText: 1. Mild. Constipation or unexplained vomiting / diarrhea < 1/week
validValue.description: 1. Mild. Constipation or unexplained vomiting / diarrhea < 1/week

validValue.meaningText: 2. Moderate. Moderate constipation (some relief with laxative treatment) or unexplained vomiting / diarrhoea > 3/week
validValue.description: 2. Moderate. Moderate constipation (some relief with laxative treatment) or unexplained vomiting / diarrhoea > 3/week

validValue.meaningText: 3. Severe. Severe constipation (no relief with laxative treatment) or unexplained vomiting / diarrhoea every day or surgical intervention for dysmotility
validValue.description: 3. Severe. Severe constipation (no relief with laxative treatment) or unexplained vomiting / diarrhoea every day or surgical intervention for dysmotility

question.questionText: Rate system specific involvement during the preceding 6 month period only unless otherwise stated in the question. Endocrine (disease_progressionregression_2to11_systeminvolvement_endocrine)

validValue.meaningText: 1. Mild. Biochemical evidence of impaired function
validValue.description: 1. Mild. Biochemical evidence of impaired function

validValue.meaningText: 2. Moderate. Endocrine failure requiring replacement therapy
validValue.description: 2. Moderate. Endocrine failure requiring replacement therapy

validValue.meaningText: 3. Severe. Endocrine decompensation (e.g. diabetic ketoacidosis, Addisonian crisis)
validValue.description: 3. Severe. Endocrine decompensation (e.g. diabetic ketoacidosis, Addisonian crisis)

question.questionText: Rate system specific involvement during the preceding 6 month period only unless otherwise stated in the question. respiratory (disease_progressionregression_2to11_systeminvolvement_respiratory)

validValue.meaningText: 1. Mild. Abnormal respiratory pattern not requiring hospitalization
validValue.description: 1. Mild. Abnormal respiratory pattern not requiring hospitalization

validValue.meaningText: 2. Moderate. Abnormal respiration requiring oxygen flow or hospitalisation but not ventilation
validValue.description: 2. Moderate. Abnormal respiration requiring oxygen flow or hospitalisation but not ventilation

validValue.meaningText: 3. Severe. Abnormal respiration requiring artificial ventilation
validValue.description: 3. Severe. Abnormal respiration requiring artificial ventilation

question.questionText: Rate system specific involvement during the preceding 6 month period only unless otherwise stated in the question. cardiovascular (disease_progressionregression_2to11_systeminvolvement_cardiovascular)

validValue.meaningText: 2. Moderate. Abnormal echocardiogram (e.g. cardiomegaly) or sustained / symptomatic arrhythmia on ECG
validValue.description: 2. Moderate. Abnormal echocardiogram (e.g. cardiomegaly) or sustained / symptomatic arrhythmia on ECG

validValue.meaningText: 3. Severe. Decompensated cardiomyopathy or requiring pacing device / defibrillator / ablation
validValue.description: 3. Severe. Decompensated cardiomyopathy or requiring pacing device / defibrillator / ablation

question.questionText: Rate system specific involvement during the preceding 6 month period only unless otherwise stated in the question. Renal (disease_progressionregression_2to11_systeminvolvement_renal)

validValue.meaningText: 1. Mild. Impaired function but no change in diet or therapy required
validValue.description: 1. Mild. Impaired function but no change in diet or therapy required

validValue.meaningText: 2. Moderate. Impaired function requiring restricted protein diet
validValue.description: 2. Moderate. Impaired function requiring restricted protein diet

question.questionText: Rate system specific involvement during the preceding 6 month period only unless otherwise stated in the question. Liver (disease_progressionregression_2to11_systeminvolvement_liver)

validValue.meaningText: 1. Mild. Mildly impaired Liver Function Tests (LFTs). No symptoms of hepatic Failure
validValue.description: 1. Mild. Mildly impaired Liver Function Tests (LFTs). No symptoms of hepatic Failure

validValue.meaningText: 2. Moderate. Impaired LFTs with symptoms (e.g. jaundice, oedema)
validValue.description: 2. Moderate. Impaired LFTs with symptoms (e.g. jaundice, oedema)

validValue.meaningText: 3. Severe. Failure requiring hospitalisation and / or transplantation
validValue.description: 3. Severe. Failure requiring hospitalisation and / or transplantation

question.questionText: Rate system specific involvement during the preceding 6 month period only unless otherwise stated in the question. blood (disease_progressionregression_2to11_systeminvolvement_blood)

validValue.meaningText: 3. Severe. Pancytopenia requiring regular transfusion / transplantation
validValue.description: 3. Severe. Pancytopenia requiring regular transfusion / transplantation

question.questionText: Section III: Current Clinical Assessment Rate current status according to the clinician's examination at the time of assessment unless otherwise stated in the question. (section_iii_220702)

Rate current status according to the clinician's examination at the time of assessment unless otherwise stated in the question. Growth (ht and weight) over preceding 6 months (disease_progressionregression_2to11_currentclinical_growthweight)

validValue.meaningText: 1. Mild. Weight less than second centile but growing parallel to it
validValue.description: 1. Mild. Weight less than second centile but growing parallel to it

validValue.meaningText: 3. Severe. Weight crossing ? 2 centiles or less than 2nd centile with divergent trajectory
validValue.description: 3. Severe. Weight crossing ? 2 centiles or less than 2nd centile with divergent trajectory

question.questionText: IMAGE disease_progression_and_regression (disease_progression_and_regression)

Rate current status according to the clinician's examination at the time of assessment unless otherwise stated in the question. Development over preceding 6months __ Score (disease_progressionregression_2to11_currentclinical_development)

validValue.meaningText: 1. Development is not age appropriate, child has not regressed in any area of development, child is not globally delayed in development, AND (1) evidence of delayed speech, language or hearing, or (2) evidence of delayed motor milestones, or (3) evidence of delay in social development, AND there is development progress
validValue.description: 1. Development is not age appropriate, child has not regressed in any area of development, child is not globally delayed in development, AND (1) evidence of delayed speech, language or hearing, or (2) evidence of delayed motor milestones, or (3) evidence of delay in social development, AND there is development progress

validValue.meaningText: 2. Development is not age appropriate, child has not regressed in any area of development, child is not globally delayed in development, AND (1) evidence of delayed speech, language or hearing, or (2) evidence of delayed motor milestones, or (3) evidence of delay in social development, AND there is NO development progress
validValue.description: 2. Development is not age appropriate, child has not regressed in any area of development, child is not globally delayed in development, AND (1) evidence of delayed speech, language or hearing, or (2) evidence of delayed motor milestones, or (3) evidence of delay in social development, AND there is NO development progress

validValue.meaningText: 5. Development is not age appropriate, child has not regressed in any area of development, child is globally delayed in development, but there is developmental progress
validValue.description: 5. Development is not age appropriate, child has not regressed in any area of development, child is globally delayed in development, but there is developmental progress

validValue.meaningText: 6. Development is not age appropriate, child has not regressed in any area of development, child is globally delayed in development, and there is no developmental progress
validValue.description: 6. Development is not age appropriate, child has not regressed in any area of development, child is globally delayed in development, and there is no developmental progress

validValue.meaningText: 7. Development is not age appropriate and child has regressed in an area of development
validValue.description: 7. Development is not age appropriate and child has regressed in an area of development

question.questionText: Rate current status according to the clinician's examination at the time of assessment unless otherwise stated in the question. Vision (disease_progressionregression_2to11_currentclinical_vision)

validValue.meaningText: 0. Normal. Visual acuity better than or equal to 6/12 or normal fixation and Tracking
validValue.description: 0. Normal. Visual acuity better than or equal to 6/12 or normal fixation and Tracking

validValue.meaningText: 1. Mild. Acuity worse than 6/12 but better than or equal to 6/18 or no fixation on small objects
validValue.description: 1. Mild. Acuity worse than 6/12 but better than or equal to 6/18 or no fixation on small objects

validValue.meaningText: 2. Moderate. Acuity worse than 6/18 but better than or equal to 6/60 or impaired fixation on large, brightly coloured objects
validValue.description: 2. Moderate. Acuity worse than 6/18 but better than or equal to 6/60 or impaired fixation on large, brightly coloured objects

validValue.meaningText: 3. Severe. Acuity worse than 6/60 or no response to light or visual threat or unable to finger count
validValue.description: 3. Severe. Acuity worse than 6/60 or no response to light or visual threat or unable to finger count

question.questionText: Rate current status according to the clinician's examination at the time of assessment unless otherwise stated in the question. Ptosis and Eye Movement (disease_progressionregression_2to11_currentclinical_ptosiseyemovement)

validValue.meaningText: 1. Mild. Gaze evoked nystagmus or unilateral ptosis or impaired eye movement at extremities
validValue.description: 1. Mild. Gaze evoked nystagmus or unilateral ptosis or impaired eye movement at extremities

validValue.meaningText: 2. Moderate. Intermittent nystagmus at rest or bilateral ptosis not obscuring pupils or restriction of >50% eye movement
validValue.description: 2. Moderate. Intermittent nystagmus at rest or bilateral ptosis not obscuring pupils or restriction of >50% eye movement

validValue.meaningText: 3. Severe. Continuous nystagmus at rest or bilateral ptosis obscuring pupils or only a flicker of eye movement
validValue.description: 3. Severe. Continuous nystagmus at rest or bilateral ptosis obscuring pupils or only a flicker of eye movement

question.questionText: Rate current status according to the clinician's examination at the time of assessment unless otherwise stated in the question. Myopathy (disease_progressionregression_2to11_currentclinical_myopathy)

validValue.meaningText: 1. Mild. Mild symmetrical weakness of hip and / or shoulder girdle only
validValue.description: 1. Mild. Mild symmetrical weakness of hip and / or shoulder girdle only

validValue.meaningText: 2. Moderate. Moderate symmetrical weakness (proximal>distal) limiting mobility
validValue.description: 2. Moderate. Moderate symmetrical weakness (proximal>distal) limiting mobility

validValue.meaningText: 3. Severe. Wheelchair / carrier dependent or respiratory compromise due to Myopathy
validValue.description: 3. Severe. Wheelchair / carrier dependent or respiratory compromise due to Myopathy

question.questionText: Rate current status according to the clinician's examination at the time of assessment unless otherwise stated in the question. Ataxia (disease_progressionregression_2to11_currentclinical_ataxia)

validValue.meaningText: 1. Mild. Ataxic gait but walks unaided or mild upper limb dysmetria
validValue.description: 1. Mild. Ataxic gait but walks unaided or mild upper limb dysmetria

validValue.meaningText: 2. Moderate. Gait abnormality requiring assistance or severe upper limb Dysmetria
validValue.description: 2. Moderate. Gait abnormality requiring assistance or severe upper limb Dysmetria

validValue.meaningText: 3. Severe. Wheelchair dependent or unable to feed due to ataxia
validValue.description: 3. Severe. Wheelchair dependent or unable to feed due to ataxia

question.questionText: Rate current status according to the clinician's examination at the time of assessment unless otherwise stated in the question. Pyramidal (disease_progressionregression_2to11_currentclinical_pyramidal)

validValue.meaningText: 1. Mild. Mild hemiplegia allowing unaided ambulation
validValue.description: 1. Mild. Mild hemiplegia allowing unaided ambulation

validValue.meaningText: 2. Moderate. Moderate hemiplegia allowing ambulation with aids
validValue.description: 2. Moderate. Moderate hemiplegia allowing ambulation with aids

validValue.meaningText: 3. Severe. Wheelchair dependent due to hemi / tetraplegia
validValue.description: 3. Severe. Wheelchair dependent due to hemi / tetraplegia

question.questionText: Rate current status according to the clinician's examination at the time of assessment unless otherwise stated in the question. Extrapyramidal (disease_progressionregression_2to11_currentclinical_extrapyramidal)

validValue.meaningText: 1. Mild. Focal dystonia or unilateral extrapyramidal tremor / bradykinesia
validValue.description: 1. Mild. Focal dystonia or unilateral extrapyramidal tremor / bradykinesia

validValue.meaningText: 2. Moderate. Generalised dystonia or bilateral extrapyramidal tremor / Bradykinesia
validValue.description: 2. Moderate. Generalised dystonia or bilateral extrapyramidal tremor / Bradykinesia

validValue.meaningText: 3. Severe. Wheelchair dependent due to extrapyramidal disorder
validValue.description: 3. Severe. Wheelchair dependent due to extrapyramidal disorder

question.questionText: Rate current status according to the clinician's examination at the time of assessment unless otherwise stated in the question. Neuropathy (disease_progressionregression_2to11_currentclinical_neuropathy)

validValue.meaningText: 2. Moderate. Sensory ataxia or motor impairment (distal weakness) but mobile
validValue.description: 2. Moderate. Sensory ataxia or motor impairment (distal weakness) but mobile

validValue.meaningText: 3. Severe. Reliant on mobility aids primarily due to neuropathy
validValue.description: 3. Severe. Reliant on mobility aids primarily due to neuropathy

question.questionText: Section IV: Quality of Life Parent Completed This survey asks for your views about your child's recent health. Please answer every question by marking an 'x' in the box next to the phrase which best describes your answer. (section_iv_220702)
During the past 4 weeks, how would you rate your child's overall health? (disease_progressionregression_2to11_qol_overallhealth)

During the past 4 weeks, how much did your child's physical health problems limit their physical activities (such as walking or playing with friends)? (disease_progressionregression_2to11_qol_phsyicalactivities)

During the past 4 weeks, how much did your child's health problems limit their everyday life (such as attending school, caring for themselves) compared with a person of the same age in perfect health? (disease_progressionregression_2to11_qol_limits)
During the past 4 weeks, how much energy did your child have? (disease_progressionregression_2to11_qol_energy)
During the past 4 weeks, how much bodily pain / discomfort did your child have? (disease_progressionregression_2to11_qol_pain)
During the past 4 weeks, how much was your child bothered by emotional problems? (disease_progressionregression_2to11_qol_emotionalproblems)
During the past 4 weeks, how satisfied did your child feel with their abilities, looks, relationships with other people and life in general? (disease_progressionregression_2to11_qol_abilitieslooks)
During the past 4 weeks, how would you rate your child's behavior compared with other children his / her age? (disease_progressionregression_2to11_qol_behavior)

During the past 4 weeks, how would you rate your child's ability to interact with other people (e.g. making friends, talking to other children / strangers) compared with other children his / her age? (disease_progressionregression_2to11_qol_interactions)

During the past 4 weeks, how much were you (the parent / carer) bothered by emotional problems (e.g. feelings of anxiety, sadness) as a result of your child's illness? (disease_progressionregression_2to11_qol_parentemotions)
During the past 4 weeks, how much was your time limited as a result of your child's illness? (disease_progressionregression_2to11_qol_timelimited)
During the past 4 weeks, how much were your family's activities limited or interrupted as a result of your child's illness? (disease_progressionregression_2to11_qol_activitieslimited)
During the past 6 months, what has been the financial cost of your child's illness? (disease_progressionregression_2to11_qol_financialcost)
During the past 4 weeks, how would you rate your family's ability to get along with one another? (disease_progressionregression_2to11_qol_getalong)

During the past 4 weeks, how often did your child's illness have a positive effect on your child, you or your family (e.g. being treated well due to illness, meeting new people)? (disease_progressionregression_2to11_qol_positiveeffects)
Section IV: Quality of Life Self Completed 711 years (section_iv_7_11_220702)
During the past 4 weeks, how would you rate your overall health? (disease_progressionregression_2to11_qolself_overallhealth)

During the past 4 weeks, how much did your physical health problems limit your physical activities (such as walking or playing with friends)? (disease_progressionregression_2to11_qolself_physicalproblems)

During the past 4 weeks, how much did your health problems limit your everyday life (such as going to school, caring for yourself) compared with a person of your age in perfect health? (disease_progressionregression_2to11_qolself_healthlimits)
During the past 4 weeks, how much energy did you have? (disease_progressionregression_2to11_qolself_energy)
During the past 4 weeks, how much pain or discomfort did you have? (disease_progressionregression_2to11_qolself_pain)
During the past 4 weeks, how much were you bothered by emotional problems (such as feeling sad or frightened)? (disease_progressionregression_2to11_qolself_emotionalproblems)
During the past 4 weeks, how satisfied did you feel with your abilities, looks, relationships with other people and life in general? (disease_progressionregression_2to11_qolself_abilitieslooks)
During the past 4 weeks, how would you rate your behaviour compared with other children your age? (disease_progressionregression_2to11_qolself_behaviour)

During the past 4 weeks, how easy did you find it to get on with other people (e.g. making friends, talking to other children / strangers) compared with other children your age? (disease_progressionregression_2to11_qolself_friends)
During the past 4 weeks, how would you rate your family's ability to get along with one another? (disease_progressionregression_2to11_qolself_family)

During the past 4 weeks, how often did your illness have a positive effect on you or your family (e.g. being treated well because of your illness, meeting new people)? (disease_progressionregression_2to11_qolself_positiveeffects)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The Newcastle Paediatric Mitochondrial Disease Scale (NPMDS) and the Newcastle Mitochondrial Disease Adult Scale (NMDAS) can be used to evaluate the progression of mitochondrial disease. There are three versions of the NPMDS, each for a specific age range (0-24 months, 2-11 years, and 12-18 years). The NMDAS is for adult patients over 16 years. The aim of the scales is to allow for standardization of patient assessment and to improve accurate data collection. The scales are composed of multiple domains: Current Function, System Specific Involvement, Current Clinical Assessment, and Quality of Life. Almost all questions provide a score which ranges from 0-3, with the following representations: 0 is normal, 1 is mild, 2 moderate, and 3 severe. Examples of each severity for each question are provided. Depending on the domain, the questions are either self-administrated or based on a provider's clinical assessment. There is a manual for each scale, which details the administration, process, and scoring instructions.

form.longName: PhenX PX220703 - Disease Progression And Regression 12-18 Years
form.preferredDefinition: The Newcastle Paediatric Mitochondrial Disease Scale (NPMDS) and the Newcastle Mitochondrial Disease Adult Scale (NMDAS) can be used to evaluate the progression of mitochondrial disease. There are three versions of the NPMDS, each for a specific age range (0-24 months, 2-11 years, and 12-18 years). The NMDAS is for adult patients over 16 years. The investigators from Newcastle University recommend that if the child experiences early onset of a mitochondrial disease in childhood, the NPMDS 12-18 year scale should be used. If an adolescent experiences onset of a mitochondrial disease, the investigators recommend switching to the NMDAS scale at 16 years. The scales allow for standardization of patient assessment and to improve accurate data collection. The scales are composed of multiple domains: Current Function, System Specific Involvement, Current Clinical Assessment, and Quality of Life. Almost all questions provide a score which ranges from 0-3, with the following representations: 0 is normal, 1 is mild, 2 is moderate, and 3 is severe. Examples of severity for each question are provided. Depending on the domain, the questions are either self- or interviewer-administrated, based on a provider's clinical assessment or medical records. There is a manual for each scale, which details the administration, process, and scoring instructions.

headerInstruction.text: The Newcastle Paediatric Mitochondrial Disease Scale (NPMDS) 12 18 years

question.questionText: Date of assessment: (disease_progressionregression_12to18_date)
Age at assessment: (disease_progressionregression_12to18_age)
Parental consanguinity: (disease_progressionregression_12to18_parental_consanguinity)
Age at presentation: (disease_progressionregression_12to18_parental_agepresentation)
Age at clinical diagnosis: (disease_progressionregression_12to18_parentalage_agedx)
Genotype if known: (disease_progressionregression_12to18_genotype)
Biochemical phenotype if known: (disease_progressionregression_12to18_biochemical_phenotype)
Basis of clinical diagnosis e.g. MRI, blood / CSF lactate (disease_progressionregression_12to18_basis_diagnosis)
Information regarding pregnancy: (info_preg_220703)
reduced fetal movements (disease_progressionregression_12to18_reduced_fetalmovement)
cardiomyopathy on antenatal scans (disease_progressionregression_12to18_pregnancy_cardiomyopathy_antenatal)
abnormalities on fetal anomaly scan (disease_progressionregression_12to18_abnormalities_fetalscan)
Other (disease_progressionregression_12to18_pregnancy_cardiomyopathy_pregnancyother)
Neonatal information: (neonatal_info_220703)
gestational age in weeks (disease_progressionregression_12to18_neonatal_gestationalage)
delivery method (NVD vs instrumental vs C/S) (disease_progressionregression_12to18_neonatal_deliverymethod)
birth weight in kg (disease_progressionregression_12to18_neonatal_birthweight)
Resuscitation and ventilation (disease_progressionregression_12to18_neonatal_resuscitationventilation)

Section I: Function Rate function during the preceding 4 week period only according to patient and / or caregiver interview. Indicate the score that best fits patient's functional status independently of the nature of the signs (section_1_220703)
Rate function during the preceding 4 week period only according to patient and / or caregiver interview. Vision (disease_progressionregression_12to18_currentfunction_vision)

validValue.meaningText: 1. Mild. Difficulty with small print or text on the television
validValue.description: 1. Mild. Difficulty with small print or text on the television

validValue.meaningText: 2. Moderate. Difficulty outside the home (e.g. bus numbers, road signs or shopping)
validValue.description: 2. Moderate. Difficulty outside the home (e.g. bus numbers, road signs or shopping)

validValue.meaningText: 3. Severe. Difficulty recognising faces or unable to navigate without help or registered blind
validValue.description: 3. Severe. Difficulty recognising faces or unable to navigate without help or registered blind

validValue.meaningText: 1. Mild. Mild deafness (e.g. missing words in presence of background noise)
validValue.description: 1. Mild. Mild deafness (e.g. missing words in presence of background noise)

validValue.meaningText: 2. Moderate. Hearing impaired but fully corrected with hearing aid
validValue.description: 2. Moderate. Hearing impaired but fully corrected with hearing aid

validValue.meaningText: 3. Severe. Poor hearing even with aid or reliant on non-verbal communication
validValue.description: 3. Severe. Poor hearing even with aid or reliant on non-verbal communication

validValue.meaningText: 1. Mild. Mild speech difficulties but easily understood and rarely asked to repeat things
validValue.description: 1. Mild. Mild speech difficulties but easily understood and rarely asked to repeat things

validValue.meaningText: 2. Moderate. Speech poorly understood by strangers and frequently asked to repeat things
validValue.description: 2. Moderate. Speech poorly understood by strangers and frequently asked to repeat things

validValue.meaningText: 3. Severe. Speech not understood by family or friends and / or requires communication aid
validValue.description: 3. Severe. Speech not understood by family or friends and / or requires communication aid

validValue.meaningText: 1. Mild. Choking / vomiting / anorexia resulting in reduced intake or swallowing difficulties requiring dietary adaptations
validValue.description: 1. Mild. Choking / vomiting / anorexia resulting in reduced intake or swallowing difficulties requiring dietary adaptations

validValue.meaningText: 2. Moderate. Supplementary enteral feeding or recurrent aspiration pneumonia
validValue.description: 2. Moderate. Supplementary enteral feeding or recurrent aspiration pneumonia

validValue.meaningText: 3. Severe. Exclusive enteral feeding (gastrostomy / NG tube). Nil by mouth
validValue.description: 3. Severe. Exclusive enteral feeding (gastrostomy / NG tube). Nil by mouth

validValue.meaningText: 0. Normal. No concerns. Age appropriately reliant on carers / parents
validValue.description: 0. Normal. No concerns. Age appropriately reliant on carers / parents

validValue.meaningText: 1. Mild. Slow and / or clumsy self-care requiring extra time or effort. Requires help with some tasks
validValue.description: 1. Mild. Slow and / or clumsy self-care requiring extra time or effort. Requires help with some tasks

validValue.meaningText: 2. Moderate. Requires help with most tasks but retains some independent selfcare function
validValue.description: 2. Moderate. Requires help with most tasks but retains some independent selfcare function

validValue.meaningText: 3. Severe. Requires one to one assistance
validValue.description: 3. Severe. Requires one to one assistance

validValue.meaningText: 1. Mild. Difficulty walking up stairs or inclines
validValue.description: 1. Mild. Difficulty walking up stairs or inclines

validValue.meaningText: 2. Moderate. Requires support (stick / frame / callipers) to walk on the flat

validValue.meaningText: 1. Mild. Myoclonic or absence seizures only or < 1 generalised tonic-clonic seizure each month
validValue.description: 1. Mild. Myoclonic or absence seizures only or < 1 generalised tonic-clonic seizure each month

validValue.meaningText: 2. Moderate. > 5 generalized tonic-clonic seizures/month or > 20 absence or myoclonic seizures/month
validValue.description: 2. Moderate. > 5 generalized tonic-clonic seizures/month or > 20 absence or myoclonic seizures/month

validValue.description: 1. Mild. Transient motor symptoms lasting < 24 hours

validValue.meaningText: 1. Mild. Mild constipation or unexplained vomiting / diarrhoea < 1/week
validValue.description: 1. Mild. Mild constipation or unexplained vomiting / diarrhoea < 1/week

validValue.meaningText: 2. Moderate. Moderate constipation (some relief with laxative treatment) or unexplained vomiting / diarrhoea > 3/week
validValue.description: 2. Moderate. Moderate constipation (some relief with laxative treatment) or unexplained vomiting / diarrhoea > 3/week

validValue.meaningText: 3. Severe. Severe constipation (no relief with laxative treatment) or unexplained vomiting / diarrhoea every day or surgical intervention for dysmotility

validValue.meaningText: 1. question.questionText: Section IV: Quality of Life Parent Completed This survey asks for your views about your child's recent health. Please answer every question by marking an 'x' in the box next to the phrase which best describes your answer (section_iv_220703)
During the past 4 weeks, how would you rate your child's overall health? (disease_progressionregression_12to18_qol_overallhealth)

During the past 4 weeks, how much did your child's physical health problems limit their physical activities (such as walking or playing with friends)? (disease_progressionregression_12to18_qol_phsyicalactivities)

During the past 4 weeks, how much did your child's health problems limit their everyday life (such as attending school, caring for themselves) compared with a person of the same age in perfect health? (disease_progressionregression_12to18_qol_limits)
During the past 4 weeks, how much energy did your child have? (disease_progressionregression_12to18_qol_energy)
During the past 4 weeks, how much bodily pain / discomfort did your child have? (disease_progressionregression_12to18_qol_pain)
During the past 4 weeks, how much was your child bothered by emotional problems? (disease_progressionregression_12to18_qol_emotionalproblems)
During the past 4 weeks, how satisfied did your child feel with their abilities, looks, relationships with other people and life in general? (disease_progressionregression_12to18_qol_abilitieslooks)
During the past 4 weeks, how would you rate your child's behavior compared with other children his / her age? (disease_progressionregression_12to18_qol_behavior)

During the past 4 weeks, how would you rate your child's ability to interact with other people (e.g. making friends, talking to other children / strangers) compared with other children his / her age? (disease_progressionregression_12to18_qol_interactions)

During the past 4 weeks, how much were you (the parent / carer) bothered by emotional problems (e.g. feelings of anxiety, sadness) as a result of your child's illness? (disease_progressionregression_12to18_qol_parentemotions)
During the past 4 weeks, how much was your time limited as a result of your child's illness? (disease_progressionregression_12to18_qol_timelimited)
During the past 4 weeks, how much were your family's activities limited or interrupted as a result of your child's illness? (disease_progressionregression_12to18_qol_activitieslimited)
During the past 6 months, what has been the financial cost of your child's illness? (disease_progressionregression_12to18_qol_financialcost)
During the past 4 weeks, how would you rate your family's ability to get along with one another? (disease_progressionregression_12to18_qol_getalong)

During the past 4 weeks, how often did your child's illness have a positive effect on your child, you or your family (e.g. being treated well due to illness, meeting new people)? (disease_progressionregression_12to18_qol_positiveeffects)

Section V: Quality of Life Self Completed 1216 years This survey asks about how you have been feeling recently. Please answer every question by choosing the phrase which best describes your answer (section_v_220703)
During the past 4 weeks, how would you rate your overall health? (disease_progressionregression_12to18_qolself_overallhealth)

During the past 4 weeks, how much did your physical health problems limit your physical activities (such as walking or playing with friends)? (disease_progressionregression_12to18_qolself_physicalproblems)

During the past 4 weeks, how much did your health problems limit your everyday life (such as going to school, caring for yourself) compared with a person of your age in perfect health? (disease_progressionregression_12to18_qolself_healthlimits)
During the past 4 weeks, how much energy did you have? (disease_progressionregression_12to18_qolself_energy)
During the past 4 weeks, how much pain or discomfort did you have? (disease_progressionregression_12to18_qolself_pain)
During the past 4 weeks, how much were you bothered by emotional problems (such as feeling sad or frightened)? (disease_progressionregression_12to18_qolself_emotionalproblems)
During the past 4 weeks, how satisfied did you feel with your abilities, looks, relationships with other people and life in general? (disease_progressionregression_12to18_qolself_abilitieslooks)
During the past 4 weeks, how would you rate your behaviour compared with other children your age? (disease_progressionregression_12to18_qolself_behaviour)

During the past 4 weeks, how easy did you find it to get on with other people (e.g. making friends, talking to other children / strangers) compared with other children your age? (disease_progressionregression_12to18_qolself_friends)
During the past 4 weeks, how would you rate your family's ability to get along with one another? (disease_progressionregression_12to18_qolself_family)

During the past 4 weeks, how often did your illness have a positive effect on you or your family (e.g. being treated well because of your illness, meeting new people)? (disease_progressionregression_12to18_qolself_positiveeffects)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The Newcastle Paediatric Mitochondrial Disease Scale (NPMDS) and the Newcastle Mitochondrial Disease Adult Scale (NMDAS) can be used to evaluate the progression of mitochondrial disease. There are three versions of the NPMDS, each for a specific age range (0-24 months, 2-11 years, and 12-18 years). The NMDAS is for adult patients over 16 years. The investigators from Newcastle University recommend that if the child experiences early onset of a mitochondrial disease in childhood, the NPMDS 12-18 year scale should be used. If an adolescent experiences onset of a mitochondrial disease, the investigators recommend switching to the NMDAS scale at 16 years. The scales allow for standardization of patient assessment and to improve accurate data collection. The scales are composed of multiple domains: Current Function, System Specific Involvement, Current Clinical Assessment, and Quality of Life. Almost all questions provide a score which ranges from 0-3, with the following representations: 0 is normal, 1 is mild, 2 is moderate, and 3 is severe. Examples of severity for each question are provided. Depending on the domain, the questions are either self- or interviewer-administrated, based on a provider's clinical assessment or medical records. There is a manual for each scale, which details the administration, process, and scoring instructions.

form.preferredDefinition: The latest Tanner and Whitehouse Method, sometimes referred to as TW2, involves the interpretation of a radiograph of the left hand and wrist by a trained radiologist. The procedure includes the assessment of regions of interest (ROI) on 20 bones. The ROI include the epiphysis, metaphysis and diaphysis of each bone. The radiologist gives each ROI a numerical score and records the result. The numerical score of each ROI is summed to produce a total score.

headerInstruction.text: The TannerWhitehouse Test is an online tool which was developed by Lorentz Jantschi and Sorana Bolboaca and is available at: "http://vl.academicdirect.org/medical_informatics/bone_age/v1.0/" vl.academicdirect.org/medical_informatics/bone_age/v..TRUNCATED

protocol.preferredDefinition: The latest Tanner and Whitehouse Method, sometimes referred to as TW2, involves the interpretation of a radiograph of the left hand and wrist by a trained radiologist. The procedure includes the assessment of regions of interest (ROI) on 20 bones. The ROI include the epiphysis, metaphysis and diaphysis of each bone. The radiologist gives each ROI a numerical score and records the result. The numerical score of each ROI is summed to produce a total score.
